name: Disney's Contemporary Resort

reviews.text: We made our reservations through WDW using a Florida Residents discount. Shortly after, I found the reviews of the Contemporary on this website. I called to ensure a renovated room, and I was assured we would have one. At check-in I asked for a renovated room and the clerk said three times that it was a renovated room. When we checked in, we saw that it had peeling wallpaper in the bathroom (a small spot, not very noticeable). I told the front desk about it and was told we could transfer to a renovated room b/c none of the rooms in our building had been renovated. None of the rooms in the North Building have been renovated yet. Make your garden view reservation for the South Building only. Ask for ground floor so you have a nice patio to sit on after kids go to bed.
reviews.title: Beware unrenovated rooms
Renovated rooms are nice!
reviews.text: Long story short, we were moved, though it took time from our day, and the renovated room was a world of difference. It was gorgeous, whereas the unrenovated room was garish. The unrenovated room was excessively noisy from ordinary hall noise and air conditioning. I do not recommend the older rooms at all.
Renovated rooms are great. Food at Contemporary is pricey, but mini-fridge is in room, so consider bringing own supplies.
reviews.title: The Convenience Was Worth the Money!

reviews.text: After reading the reviews here, I insisted upon a tower room. These are the best rooms, anyways, in my opinion as they are close to everything. This is an older hotel but the new renovated rooms are actually quite nice. Double kolher sinks, flat screen tv, nice beds. A little small, but such is the case with all Disney rooms. The location can not be beat. You can WALK to the Magic Kingdom. Its like 2 blocks.
reviews.title: It worked for us!
The Worst Place on Earth!
reviews.text: The other downside is the room was a little dirty. Not like filthy, but not clean to a $400 / room standard.
I am a Disney fanatic. Almost anything Disney makes me happy. But NOT the Contemporary Resort. I had heard mixed reviews, but I figured 'how bad could it be, its almost at capacity all year'.
reviews.title: Contemporary Resort is Old, Service Lacking in the Disney Magic

likes.disliked: — The room, the Staff, Internet never worked, tv never fixed, I could go on and on

reviews.text: It's not that our stay was bad, but there wasnt much GOOD about it. They have a tower, which is almost completely renovated. It costs a lot more to stay in the tower, than in the garden wings. Its probably worth it.
reviews.title: Nice, but with some problems

reviews.text: One of the garden wings has been renovated, the South Wing and supposedly the rooms are gorgeous. The North Wing, which is where we were stuck, is not renvated, in fact, I found out from the bellman that its being prepared for demoliton (not soon enough!). It is actually pretty horrible. The decor is tacky, at best. All these wild colors and patterns and furniture from the 70s. It was not a relaxing room at all. Good thing it was dark at night in the room, otherwise there is no way anyone would ever fall asleep! Our room had bright yellow, bright green and bright blue walls. The beds were not comfortable, one of them was pretty lumpy. The other was ok, but it slanted in towards the center. The bathroom stunk! It was not because of filth, but the water itself. This smell infiltrated the whole room. The room was large, and had lots of storage. The tv was in desperate need of repair, but even after 3 calls no one ever came to do anything about it. Our room was located at the far end of the garden wing, so it was quite a walk back to the main bldg, where everything is.
reviews.title: The Tower renovated rooms are OK, not worth the price!l

likes.disliked: — not clean - hotel is average, price is too high

reviews.text: As soon as the girl gave me our room, I noticed it was in the North wing and asked if we could wait for a renovated room. She told me that every single room was already occupied. We checked in at 3:10, official check in was 3:00. I find it hard to beleive that every single South Wing room was already occupied. Saturday is a big turn over day, and I really doubt that she was telling us the truth. Even after I asked again, I told her we'd wait until later that night if we could get a South Garden room. She told us no, that the room we got is all they had. She was actually rude about it. I decided not to push it, and we accepted our room.
reviews.title: Upgrade to a tower room

reviews.text: The resort itself is really not that great. The location is only good if you are going to spend a lot of time at Magic Kingdom. You can actually walk over there. The monorail will take you to other resorts directly (Grand Floridian, Polynesian)and also to the Ticket and Transportation Center where you can transfer to another monorail to go to Epcot. You must wait for a bus to go to all the other parks, and this can be a LONG wait.
reviews.title: Not very Disney. Dirty

likes.liked: — Location the Magic Kingdom and Monorail to other hotels

reviews.text: We stayed in the Contemporary for a week in May and were located in one of the wings that hasn't been refurbished yet. The room was below the standards we came to know in other premium Disney resorts (the Polynesian and the Animal Kingdom Lodge) which is why I rated it as only OK. The room may have been on the order of a mid-level resort such as Dixie Landings. My wife tried to beg for a Tower room when we checked in, but that wasn't going to happen since we were paying a lower rate since I was attending a conference. Some of the other reviews indicate that the newly refurbished rooms are very nice, in which case it may make sense to pay for an upgrade to make sure you get a nicer room. My wife had always dreamed of staying in the Contemporary, but she was a bit disappointed.
reviews.title: Older rooms in wings fall below standards of other premium Disney hotels

reviews.text: The Contemporary still has advantages, mainly its location. We could see the Magic Kingdom fireworks pretty well (as well as hear the music) when we walked down by the tennis courts. It's also an extremely short walk to the Magic Kingdom. Access to Epcot was also good since you're on the monorail. However, you do have to rely on the bus system to get to the other parks. All-in-al, I'd pick the Polynesian or the Floridian if I wanted to stay on the monorail again. But I don't think anything could beat our stay at the Animal Kingdom lodge.
reviews.title: Disappointed - Price not worth it. Many problems so we checked out early.

reviews.text: The other problem we ran into was that staff at the front desk thinned out very quickly after 10PM. There were a lot of cast members available immediately after we returned from the park closures, but the staff was reduced to only one or two people by the time we hiked over to our room and back to the main building. That led to a petty long wait if there were any any people in line, which happened pretty regularly on the nights we were there.
reviews.title: Loved the Contemporary!

reviews.text: The reason we decided to change resorts from All Star to the Contemporary was my teenage boys wanted to rent the mini boats and swim in the pool. We come to Disney every year and this is the first year we decided to stay at a so called better resort. When we checked in we were suppose to get a garden view but instead got a view with an empty tennis court. They changed our room to a view of the lake. We were greeted every morning with ducks quacking at our patio door and when you went to sit outside you were surrounded by 20-30 ducks, birds, etc. I complained about the rooms because they were old and not up to par. The rooms are not worth the money. They said they are in the process of renovating them. In the brochure the prices however have not changed.
reviews.title: contemprary is very nice
I would stay at the Contemporary Again
reviews.text: They also lost all my information that they entered into the computer when I checked in and had to give it all over again. My bill was so screwed up because we checked out 2 days early. They billed my credit card for over $1,000 without my knowledge. We ended up going to the All Star Sports and spent the extra money on $100 dinners at Epot, MGM, etc. That was the best decision ever. The pool at the Contemporary is only 3 feet, so the boys wouldn't go swimming with the babies and their diapers. While at the Contemporary we took the monorail over to the Grand Floridian Resort and swam in their pool which was great. At night it is a little scary to go to the pool at the Contemporary because our room was so far away and I didn't want the boys to walk by themselves. It was pretty quiet and empty at 11:00 at night. We have rented the boats in the past, but this year you could not rent the boats unless you were with an adult or had a driver license. The policy was changed but nobody told me that when I called. They claim the teenagers were getting into to many accidents. The reason is the motors are bigger than the boats at downtown. So we took a bus to downtown to rent the boats. We rented them for an hour. They were so slow and my son's boat kept stalling out. What a disaster. The last part of our Florida trip was spent at Universal Hard Rock Hotel. If we go again next year we will stay at Hard Rock Hotel and drive to Disney.
We just came back from a 3 night at the Contemporary. We had a room for myself, my mom and my 3 children aged 2, 6 and 9. We had a tower room with a lake view.
reviews.title: The place to be if you have a 2 year old!!!

reviews.text: The view is beautiful! I don't think it's worth paying the extra for the theme park view as no guarantee you'll get the best park view, but the lake is gorgeous!
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room on the 8th floor facing Chef Mickey's. Everyone seems to complain about the noise but if you have your AC on then you won't be able to hear anything, otherwise the only time we heard noise was at about 6:45am. We could hear some soft music playing. We did not have our AC on. The weather was perfect. Highs on 80 and lows on the mid 60s.
reviews.title: An iconic Disney resort, with a price to match

reviews.text: The room sleeps 5. Room is nicely decorated. There was no turndown service and no chocolate on pillows, which for a deluxe resort surprised me a bit.
reviews.title: Great stay with kids

reviews.text: We did online check in so as soon as we arrived everything was ready for us. We arrived at the hotel at about 2:45 and our room was ready and the pack and play was all set! Service was great! They upgraded my mother-in-law from a garden wing room to a tower room and gave us connecting rooms. I thought that was really nice of them!!
reviews.title: Location location location

reviews.text: This was my first stay at the Contemporary, and I have to say, how long overdue this stay was. I knew going in that I wasn't going to be in a Tower room. Betty, at check-in, assured me that the walk to GWS wasn't too bad. It really wasn't. I was to my room in five minutes. Some people recommend that vacationers give Garden rooms a pass. I was happy. I had super easy access to the boat launches which I used for my visits to both Fort Wilderness properties, and I had a very nice patio. The patio provided a nice space for quiet reading, much needed after coming back from packed MK. Finally, have stayed in a variety of resorts, I can say the layout is great. Everything is centrally located. Highly recommend Contemporary, even the GW.
reviews.title: Super relaxing stay

reviews.text: Staff: Courteous, friendly service at check-in. Staff was always willing to help when I needed information (mainly driving directions).
reviews.title: Nothing Disney tells you while booking is true

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grand Concourse: Had a bit of a cruise ship feel; however, it provided everything anyone could need-bar, restaurants, shopping, cozy seating areas.
reviews.title: Beware of limited transportation options
Lacking the Disney Magic
reviews.text: Room: CR rooms seem to be the "kind" of rooms that one might find in an upscale downtown hotel in a big city i.e. Vancouver, Seattle. Disney does a fine job recreating the look and feel of those hotel rooms. Again, this is a themed hotel in WDW, so I think the resort has to be judged on its own terms, not against Hyatt standards, for example. Now, to the ins and outs of the room. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. The blackout shades help ensured a good night's sleep. The bathroom was more than I expected. Disney bathrooms, on the whole, are just too small. The space was nice. The sinks were a clever touch; however, there was limited counter space. Towels could have been of a better quality, but they sufficed. Fridge was a little hard to open, but it was useful nonetheless.
Happy I stayed here and loved the monorail access at a time when the parks were positively mobbed.
reviews.title: It's all true...to a point!

reviews.text: This is our fourth trip to contemporary over the years and it never fails to be the place for us. Quick access via monorail to parks. Great new look and feel and a caring staff. We always pay a little extra for club level with snacks all day and breakfast. And great view of fireworks from lounge (mk) - expensive but makes the trip very special.
reviews.title: Classic place to stay

reviews.text: We stayed at the Contemporary resort over the Thanksgiving holiday. Hotel was so convenient. I have heard horror stories from other parents about wait times for buses when staying off the monorail loop. The Contemporary was within walking distance of the Magic Kingdom, which was wonderful since we visited the park most every day. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. We dined at the Contempo Cafe', Chef Mickey's and the Wave at our hotel. All were good restaurants. Would definitely recommend to other travelers.
reviews.title: Expensive, but worth it if traveling with small children!

reviews.text: The hotel is huge as is the entire Disney World complex. Not so good if walking is a problem as our room was a good 10 minutes away from the entrance. The decor is still quite modern as the name suggests. The room a little small for a family of four. The double basins in the bathroom was huge and not practical.
reviews.title: Nice enough

reviews.text: POSITIVES. Fast wi fi in room and public areas. Good selection of eating options. The Contempo Cafe is great for casual meals and breakfast at reasonable prices. Direct access to monorail which takes you to Magic Kingdom and Epcot.
reviews.title: Way too much money for what it is

reviews.text: NEGATIVES. Bed not too comfortable. Bus trip to Animal Kingdom and Hollywood Studios was at least 40 minutes one way. Distance from room to theme parks vary from at least 30 minutes to an hour. Therefore need to allow plenty of time to get there in the mornings to catch all the rides and shows.
reviews.title: Great base of operations for WDW

reviews.text: Will stay here again. Loved how close to was to walk to MK. Kids were 4 and 1 and we had a double stroller. It fit into our room and on the elevator. Forgot the camera one day and was able to dad dash back to hotel and still make it in time for the Welcome show which is a must if you are going to MK. I was a bit sweaty however for our princess breakfast however but I don't think Cinderella minded. Hotel was dated as others have mentioned. Room was huge however and we in Garden wing overlooking lake. You might this is great and it is until 10:10 when the light show goes by and wakes you up every night of your stay. When the kids are older I'm sure they'll love it.
reviews.title: Close to MK

reviews.text: Stayed the week before Christmas. Early check in was great. Asked for room above sixth floor to stay away from Chef Mickey noise. Also had a magic kingdom view. View was awesome. Fireworks beautiful. Was on the 11th floor. Good thing because Chef Mickey is loud. Rooms were big and comfortable. Only complaint which you will hear in other reviews, the bathroom sinks are flat and don't drain properly. Messy but mouse keeping did a great cleaning job. Monorail convenient. Walk to MK easy. Avoid busses by driving your car to HS and AK. Quicker and nicer. Free parking since you're staying on site. Would stay again. Also, meal plan a must with Disney's high food prices. Can be done easily with some planning.
reviews.title: Great location, great rooms, need new sinks

reviews.text: I remember being a kid, and visiting Disneyworld, and seeing that really cool looking hotel that the monorail went straight through. I always remember saying "i wish I could stay there" Fast Forward to my adult life when I can now treat my family to a stay in this hotel.
reviews.title: Disney Icon

reviews.text: If you have small children, and are planning to spend most of your time at the magic kingdom, then the Contemporary is the best choice. Having a hotel room literally within 10 minutes of the theme park is essential. We were easily able to escape the midday sun and crowds to go back and enjoy the resort pool or a quick nap to recharge for the evening.
reviews.title: Disney Does It Best!

reviews.text: And after your day at the park, having the monorail drop you off at your hotel door is a terrific advantage.
reviews.title: Best location, easy access to parks but dated and dirty.

reviews.text: this hotel is the best especially if you have kids the rooms are clean the atmospher is amasing the art beautiful the check in 5 min the rooms luxiorous it is the funkiest place to stay in disney but the chef mickey song wakes you up if you stay in the tower like me pool beautiful iv been there 3 times planing the forth right now!!!!!!!!!! over all its a GREAT place to stay!
reviews.title: LOVED IT!!!!!!
Loved the contemporary
reviews.text: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the contemporary We stayed on the 10th floor in the tower which is currently the atrium club floor because the 12th floor is being refurished. We were treated great the moment we arrived. Our room was wonderful and very up to date. Staff was excellent and helped us in every way. I would say if you stay at the contemporary to stay in the tower. Views of magic kingdom were the best and right from your room balcony.. The pool was great with lots of room and waterslide. They also have a marina and you can parasail or rent a boat. The beds are very comfortable. The contemporary is so close to magic kingdom you can walk. Also lots of transportation to take you to any of the parks. My only complaint wasn't about the hotel it was the huge crowds of wall to wall people all visiting Disneyword just like we were. This was only average season but it was packed. You wait a long time to ride, eat, etc. and the buses and monrails were jam packed. They do offer fast passes for many attractions but you still wait. I can't imagine what peak season is like. They also have extra magic hours for hotel guests but it was still busy. Just think of all the hotels Disney has. You get my point it was busy. The huge crowds and long lines really took away from the fun. Plus it was very hot and we noticed that it was hard on young children waiting for rides between the heat and lines. I do have to say though that Disneyworld is so clean and kept up, they have beautiful grounds. If you go stay at the contemporary. You may not love the crowds but you;ll love the hotel. Our kids did.

reviews.title: The happiest celebration on earth-really!!
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the garden rooms, facing the lake, which had recently been renovated. The room was gorgeous and clean, with a lovely view. It was a quick walk to Disneyworld but the monorail was even quicker and so convenient, in that it passes right through the main part of the hotel. The character breakfasts in the hotel were a lot of fun, but make sure to book at least a day ahead of time. The courteous staff in the park and at the hotel made the trip magical!

reviews.title: Walt Disney World... Not.......
reviews.text: We arrived at the Contemporary Resort on April 8, 2006. Check in was very speedy and friendly. When I asked for a newly renovated room, I received my request. Our room was not ready at the time so we made our way to the parks. Upon entering the room, I was surprised at the renovations after seeing photos of the old rooms. However, the amazement did not last long. The room was not overly clean. I do no think the vacuum has been ran since the remodel. When this was mentioned to the staff, I was told that they are short staffed. It should not make a difference. You are paying for a Deluxe resort (expensive) it should be clean, not matter what.....Between the crumbs and broken crayons, lets just say it was quite disgusting. Thank goodness the sheets were clean!!!! Apparently the tub/shower was not replaced during the remodel, because the soap scum is still there. I don't think that much could build up in the couple of months since they started remodeling. However, we tried to make the best of things. When returning to the hotel from EPCOT the monorail to the Hotel and Magic Kingdom was not working. Unfortunately, there is no other way to the hotel. After standing in a line with about 500 other people for buses for about an hour, we were finally told that a bus would be going to the resorts only. After finally arriving back at the resort, we decided we had enough "Disney". We went to the desk to check out. It's amazing how friendly the staff can be upon checking in, but rude when checking out with problems. I have never dealt with a Disney employee as rude as my checkout, and I have been to Disney 8 times now and stayed on property every time. I could not recommend the Contemporary Resort to anyone. The only thing it has going for it is the location within walking distance to Magic Kingdom. I would, however, recommend the Animal Kingdom. We stayed there in August, 2005. Yes, the rooms are smaller, but they are clean. I read other reviews before I left, but decided that I would check it out myself, I wish I had listened to them.....Ending on a good note, we left Disney and went to Myrtle Beach and had a great time......better luck next time I guess.

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: So my wife has been hitting me up to go to Disney ever since our Honeymoon in 2002. Since then we have had 2 kids a 3 year old and a 10 month old. On our Honeymoon we stayed at the Grand Floridian which was great. On our recent trip I decided to go with the Contemporary cause that is where I stayed on my first visit as a child. Just assumed the rooms would be outdated, boy was I wrong. Upon checkin my 3 year old was getting stickers from a attenedee, as I was getting upgrgaded to a Tower View from a garden view on a Friday and Sat night durring the Easter Break!!! Rooms were Perfect, Plasma TV, Sheets that were comforatable , staff was great, View was even better ...Had my doubts about taking 2 boys that were so young and wont remember anything at all, but I will always remember my son as he saw the monarial pull right into the hotel there on the 4th Floor or holding him on our balcony as the fireworks were going off. This topped the Grand Floridan by a mile ..room was nicer and more of a hotel feel then a big resort feel that the Grand gives off, Arcade was great, Food was great, I will return!!! Was a magical vacation

description: Disney's Contemporary Resort is an ultra-modern Disney Deluxe Resort, made up of a towering A-frame high-rise building—the iconic Contemporary Tower—and complemented by one garden wing annex. This lakeside Resort is the only hotel in Walt Disney World Resort to have the Walt Disney World Monorail System pass through the main concourse.
